Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EasyBoard, HardBoard, PvPBoard

    public abstract class Board
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This is the board that is used for play. This class will hold the buttons and basically hold everything that the player has to interact with. It will hold the logic for making moves.
    Version:
    0.0.1
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Triggers what happens when the player clicks a spot on the board
      protected void endGame()
      Removes the action listeners for all the buttons
      protected int[] getButtCoords(int i)
      Gets the coordinates of the button that is pressed in terms of row and col

      Adds action listeners to the buttons and resets the turn counter
      protected void startOver()
      This resets the board by getting rid of the icons on the buttons, then calling the start function

      • getButtCoords

        protected int[] getButtCoords(int i)
        Gets the coordinates of the button that is pressed in terms of row and col
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the XOButton in the array butts
        Returns:
        [0] is the row, [1] is the column that the button is located in
